name: Regional Centre of the International Federation of Translators
goal:
The Fédération Internationale des Traducteurs / International Federation of Translators (FIT) is an international non-for-profit organisation which was founded in 1953. It is a federation representing more than 100 professional translator, interpreter and terminologist associations. It also has associate members that are translation / interpreting departments at universities and training institutions. It represents more than 80,000 linguists in 55 countries across the globe. The main goal of FIT is to promote professionalism in the disciplines it represents.

FIT Europe is the Regional Centre for Europe within FIT. It represents and promotes the interests of over 40,000 linguists across Europe through its professional associations of translators, interpreters and terminologists, and its associate member translation and interpreting departments at universities and training institutions.

FIT Europe provides representation for its members at European level. It is a forum for networking and for the exchange of information between its members. It also collaborates with other relevant organisations, for example, it has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with both Eulita (European Legal Interpreters and Translators Association) and CEATL (Conseil Européen des Associations de Traducteurs Littéraires).
It provides a shared platform for addressing issues of the day arising within and in connection with the profession. It is a vehicle for increasing public awareness of the importance of best practice within the profession.
The main aims of FIT Europe are:
to promote the interests of translators and interpreters in Europe,
to encourage recognition of the benefits society derives from translation, and
to coordinate national efforts to achieve formal recognition of the title and status of Translator.
